intro: Neonauclea vitiensis, commonly known as the Vitiensis Ironwood, is a tropical tree native to the island of Vanuatu. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests and is known for its ability to thrive in humid, tropical climates. Neonauclea vitiensis has small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by small, round berries. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
